page.title: 09Village Shopping
page.content: Although not a large village Swimbridge still has a public house,the Jack Russell ( named after the former vicar and formally known as the new inn ), post office, butchers shop and a general store. In the past there were 5 shops (including antique shops) and three pubs. The present shopping centre is the 'Square' in the middle of the settlement on which a group of houses once stood. The largest shop is{Boxalls General {Stores}which sells almost everything from frozen food to firelighters and newspapers to nails. This shop has been in existence for many years. A year or two ago a van coming down Station Hill went out of control and smashed straight into Boxhalls causing much of the shop front to be renewed.
